messages.content: What is ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?
ComfyUI-N-Sidebar is a simple sidebar extension for ComfyUI that adds features like drag and drop nodes, pinning favorite nodes, searching within nodes and categories, and custom categories.
How do I install ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?
To install ComfyUI-N-Sidebar, clone the repository to your ComfyUI custom_nodes directory using the command: git clone https://github.com/Nuked88/ComfyUI-N-Sidebar.git
How do I update ComfyUI-N-Sidebar to the latest version?
To update ComfyUI-N-Sidebar, navigate to the cloned repository folder custom_nodes/ComfyUI-N-Sidebar and run the command: git pull
What is the purpose of the settings.json file in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?
The settings.json file in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar stores the most important settings for the extension.
How can I set the workflows folder in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?
To set the workflows folder in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar, open the settings, go to WORKFLOW PATHS, and set the folder path to where your workflows are located. Restart ComfyUI for the changes to take effect.
Does ComfyUI-N-Sidebar support fuzzy search?
Yes, ComfyUI-N-Sidebar has fuzzy search enabled by default, allowing for more flexible searching within nodes and categories.
How can I contribute to the development of ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?
You can contribute to ComfyUI-N-Sidebar by reporting issues, suggesting improvements, or submitting pull requests on the GitHub repository.
Is ComfyUI-N-Sidebar an open-source project?
Yes, ComfyUI-N-Sidebar is an open-source project licensed under the MIT License.
What are the prerequisites for submitting a bug report for ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?

Before submitting a bug report for ComfyUI-N-Sidebar, you should: 1) Verify the issue in a different browser or incognito mode, 2) Remove additional nodes except for ComfyUI-N-Sidebar and ComfyUI-Manager, launch ComfyUI and test if the problem persists, and 3) Identify any node conflicts.
How can you rule out cache-related issues when encountering a bug with ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?

To rule out cache-related issues, you can try to reproduce the issue in incognito mode or clear the cache for the ComfyUI address in your browser settings. You can also try force reloading the page with Ctrl + F5 on Windows or Cmd + Shift + R on macOS.
What should you do if the problem with ComfyUI-N-Sidebar is resolved after removing additional nodes?

If the problem with ComfyUI-N-Sidebar is resolved after removing additional nodes, it is likely caused by a conflict with one of the removed nodes. You should try to identify the conflicting node, and if found, open an issue to inform the developer so they can attempt to resolve the problem.
What information should be provided in the bug report for ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?

In the bug report for ComfyUI-N-Sidebar, you should provide a brief description of the bug, steps to reproduce the issue, expected behavior, actual behavior, and system information including the operating system and browser.
How can you restore the original situation after removing nodes for testing ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?
To restore the original situation after removing nodes for testing ComfyUI-N-Sidebar, you can move the nodes back from the temporary folder to the 'custom_nodes' folder and restart ComfyUI.
What additional context can be provided in a bug report for ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?
In a bug report for ComfyUI-N-Sidebar, you can provide any additional information that may help in resolving the issue as additional context.
What nodes should be kept when testing for conflicts with ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?
When testing for conflicts with ComfyUI-N-Sidebar, you should keep the ComfyUI-N-Sidebar node and, if present, the ComfyUI-Manager node. All other nodes should be removed for testing.
What is the purpose of the 'Feature request' in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?
The 'Feature request' in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar is used to suggest an idea for the project.
What should be included in the title when making a feature request for ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?
When making a feature request for ComfyUI-N-Sidebar, the title should include '[Feature request] ' followed by the suggested idea.
What label is assigned to a feature request in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?
A feature request in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar is assigned the label 'enhancement'.
Are there any assignees for a feature request in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar by default?
No, there are no assignees for a feature request in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar by default. The assignees field is left blank.
What is the format for submitting a feature request in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?

The format for submitting a feature request in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar includes the name 'Feature request', the 'about' field describing the purpose, the title format '[Feature request] ', the label 'enhancement', and no assignees by default.
Does a feature request in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar have a default assignee?
No, a feature request in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar does not have a default assignee. The assignees field is left blank.
What label is used to categorize a feature request in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?
The label used to categorize a feature request in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar is 'enhancement'.
